title: unesco_heritage_La_Lonja_de_la_Seda_de_Valencia
text:
Name: La Lonja de la Seda de Valencia. short_description:

Built between 1482 and 1533, this group of buildings was originally used for trading in silk (hence its name, the Silk Exchange) and it has always been a centre for commerce. It is a masterpiece of late Gothic architecture. The grandiose Sala de Contrataci√≥n (Contract or Trading Hall), in particular, illustrates the power and wealth of a major Mediterranean mercantile city in the 15th and 16th centuries.
